import "../components/Timeline.css"; function Timeline() { return (

Adam Harper's Life (so far)

  • May 2023
    I'm a Dad!
    On 9th May 2023, Adam became a father for the first time to Reuben Jospeph Thomas Harper
  • August 2022
    I'm an Application Developer
    After a two year journey of University and self-guided learning, I was offered the role of Application Developer at InHealthcare. Despite being on course for a First Class Honours Degree The decision was made to leave University and continue my programming journey 'on the job'.
  • October 2020
    When you know, you know
    During a re-enforced lockdown, we made our vows in our masks and I married the love of my life.
  • September 2020
    BSc Web Programming
    I began my studies as a full time, mature student at the University of Huddersfield studying towards a BSC Web Programming. I gained experience in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Wordpress, PHP, SQL Databases, R, Cyber Security, SQL, Adobe applications (Photoshop, Illustrator, Animate), Figma.
  • January 2020
    Relocating to Yorkshire
    Just prior to the global pandemic I relocated to Yorkshire to be with my future wife. I secured a role of Export Specialist, training a new team for Drive Devilbiss Healthcare on export procedures and documentation.



    Perhaps a blessing in disguise, the pandemic resulted in complications in carrying out my role, I was subsequently furloughed and used this time to reflect and choose a new path in my career. I decided to pursue something that merged my pragmatic, logical approach to solving problems with my creativiity - programming.



    In my personal time I began to focus primarily on JavaScript after hearing about how versatile and in demand this language is.
  • February 2019
    John Yorke's Advanced Structure Masterclass
    I spent a long weekend at Ealing Studios on a screenwriting class with John Yorke, previously head of drama at BBC and Channel 4.



    I made many new friends and fond memories on this weekend. It was an experience that took me out of my comfort zone in many ways, specifically having to pitch a drama episode to a room full of people (and John himself) in a historically famous studio was something else.



    I believe my knowledge of storytelling has helped me professionally. I still like to write scripts in my spare time, much like programming, I become engrossed in the process.
  • September 2018
    London Screenwriters Festival
    Another example of getting out of my comfort zone. Too many memories and experiences to relay here but the festival is/was a series of events with guest speakers - some informative, some anecdotal but all inspiring. Meeting many like-minded story enthusiasts was great. A highlight is the elevator pitch where you must pitch your idea to a mystery guest within 30 seconds!
  • September 2013
    Start at Ishida Europe
    I spent six happy years at this manufacturing company, exporting equipment worldwide and having to learn and adapt to the ever-changing world of exports.



    Many projects involved equipment/exports worth millions of pounds and so there were often periods of extreme pressure and risk but I learned to thrive in the experience.



    I owe a lot to this company in terms of my logic, organisation, confidence and belief that I can overcome obstacles that arise.
  • April 2012
    Hardcore Punk European Tour
    Another hobby of mine for many years is music. I played bass guitar in the band History of the Hawk which culminated in a tour of Eastern Europe.



    I wish I could say it all went without a hitch but there were cancelled shows, multiple flat tyres, near misses and navigation issues. Lets just call it a character building exercise.



    We disbanded not long after the tour but remain friends to this day.
  • 2007 - 2011
    Science vs Romance
    Before the hardcore punk rock there was the indie pop-rock of Science vs Romance. I learned many lessons and experienced many things I never expected in this band.



    Two tours of the UK supporting major label acts (Twin Atlantic, Far, Circa Survive), festival appearances, magazine coverage, attracting interest from some of my musical heroes.



    As a self-labelled introvert I'm starting to realise that my life story doesn't quite read that way!
  • March 2004
    Cancer is the worst
    Just a day after my 20th birthday, after a 6 month battle with lung cancer, my mom passed away.



    As many other know all to well, it is traumatising to watch someone
); } export default Timeline;
